title: Co-Teaching Strategy Development for Hybrid Synchronous Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and fundamental concepts of secondary-level social studies
context.additional_context: A real-time blended (online/offline) instruction process where two instructors collaboratively deliver social studies content

learning_goals: Learners can explain the seven core elements of co-teaching (lesson design, discussion facilitation, direct instruction, assessment, supplementary explanation, classroom management, and emotional support) in a blended synchronous environment
Learners can design three or more collaborative scenarios by utilizing role-sharing strategies between online and offline instructors
Learners can utilize tools to quantitatively and qualitatively measure the effect of improved student engagement when applying co-teaching methods
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
